name: Normal matrix
summary:
In mathematics, a complex square matrix A is normal if it commutes with its conjugate transpose A*:

  
    
      
        A
        
           normal
        
        
        ⟺
        
        
          A
          
            ∗
          
        
        A
        =
        A
        
          A
          
            ∗
          
        
        .
      
    
    {\displaystyle A{\text{ normal}}\iff A^{*}A=AA^{*}.}
  

The concept of normal matrices can be extended to normal operator
